block.p: A birthday bash in in honor of Wallace Stevens, a favorite son, poet and insurance executive of his adopted hometown of Hartford, will feature a talk by Richard Howard, Pulitzer Prize-winning poet, critic and translator. His subject will be ''Even in Paris: Wallace Stevens and French Culture.''

The birthday bashes were established five years ago as a means of continuing Stevens' influential work in promoting the city's cultural life. The program will be held on Saturday at the Hartford Public Library, 500 Main Street, from 6:30 to 10 p.m. Tickets at $25 include hors d'oeuvres, champagne, music and birthday cake. For reservations or more information call (860) 543-8652.

A ''Compleat Fly-Fishing Fair'' is to be held on Saturday in Old Saybrook, presenting comprehensive information about the sport from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Experts will be on hand with lectures and demonstrations and members of fly-fishing clubs will take aspiring young fly-fisherfolk under their wings for instruction.

One of the more intriguing lectures is called ''Fly-Fishing from a Kayak,'' to be delivered by Chris Lento and Brian Conklin. ''Fly-Fishing for Weakfish,'' ''Fly-Rodding the Coast'' and ''Fly-Fishing the Farmington'' will be discussed respectively by Capt. Jim White, Ed Mitchell, and Don Butler and Bob Kneeland.

In addition to fly-fishing, other activities in the great outdoors will be covered by talks and demonstrations on packing a backpack properly, using an outdoor camp stove, building a rope bridge, and in a simulation of perpendicular terrain -- negotiating an outdoor climbing wall.

Authors will be signing books, and a fully loaded river-tripping canoe will be on display, along with salt-water fly-fishing boats and all manner of equipment. The event takes place at the North Cove Outfitters, 75 Main Street. Call (860) 388-6585 for more information or check out www.northcove.com.

The Naugautuck River Valley's seven towns will take part in a Valley River Festival from Friday through Sunday. Fifty varied events to be offered include a concert by Giacomo Gates and the Jazz Haven Ensemble on Friday from 7 to 10 p.m. in Derby and a bass fishing tournament and raft race on Sunday afternoon at Indian Well State Park in Shelton.

Rowing lessons will be available on Friday at the restored Yale boathouse, cemetery tours will be conducted in Derby and Ansonia, canal tours are on the agenda in Shelton and an eight-hour regatta is scheduled in Derby on Saturday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m.
Swing favorites from the 40's will be performed by Al Martino's Big Band on Sunday in Shelton High School at 7 p.m., while The Shirelles will headline two concerts at 7 and 9 p.m. on the Derby Green.

Food, crafts, canoeing, kayaking, hiking and non-stop entertainment will prevail all weekend, much of it free of charge. Ticketed event include the Gates concert at $15, and the Martino concert at $25. For tickets or more information call (203) 922-8222 or try the Web site: electronicvalley.org/celebration.
